summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors discussing investigative steps in the Epstein case. It covers scheduling interviews with two sisters who worked with Epstein and may have information about coercive sexual encounters, and mentions a publicist, R. Couri Hay, who had recent conversations with Epstein about his reputation and past conduct.

persons.name: Stan
persons.role: Colleague or contact of the prosecutor
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the prosecutor has asked to propose possible times for an interview with the sisters later in the week.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: Referenced in New York Times stories as having been told by Epstein about his prior conduct; Epstein discussed improving his reputation and characterized the girls he had sex with as 'tweens and teens.' Prosecutors are seeking to contact him, potentially with a subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation; his prior conduct and conversations with publicist R. Couri Hay about his reputation and the nature of his offenses are discussed.

connections.description: Epstein had a conversation with Hay about improving his reputation and discussed the nature of his prior conduct, specifically stating the girls were 'tweens and teens.'
Indirect connection via the prosecutor's request for Stan to help schedule an interview with individuals who worked with Epstein.

events.title: Prosecutors seek interview with sisters
events.description: Federal prosecutors aim to schedule a meeting with two sisters who previously worked with Jeffrey Epstein, believing they have useful information and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.

events.title: Epstein's conversation with publicist
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had a conversation with publicist R. Couri Hay about continuing to improve his reputation, asserting his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia and the girls were 'tweens and teens.'

keyFacts: Prosecutors are seeking to interview two sisters who previously worked with Epstein and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.

Publicist R. Couri Hay was referenced in New York Times stories as having been told by Epstein, just three months prior (around April 2019), about Epstein's efforts to improve his reputation and his characterization of his victims.
Epstein told Hay that what he was convicted of did not constitute pedophilia, and that the girls he had sex with were 'tweens and teens.'
Prosecutors are prepared to issue a subpoena to R. Couri Hay if he does not agree to an informal interview.
The correspondence indicates active investigative steps by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in July 2019, shortly before Epstein's arrest.
